CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 4, 1956, pg. A12 reads: "March for Polio - These young ladies marched through Schenley Heights for the Mothers' March on Polio recently. Pictured from left to right are Gloria Ledbetter, LaVerne Perry, Bonita Ford, and right to left, Drea Jean Washington, Marsha Hord, president; Saundra Stevens, Donna Youngblood, Arlene Banks, treasurer; Yvonne Banks, Audrey Walton, Audrey Page, vice president, and Dianne Moore, secretary.  Not pictured are Patricia Redmond, Patricia Roberts, Sheldon Delaney and Joyce Sharpe.  Mrs. Eunice W. Cook is sponsor and chairman of the Hill District March of Dimes campaign. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Gloria Ledbetter, LaVerne Perry, Bonita Ford, Drea Jean Washington, Marsha Hord, Saundra Stevens, Donna Youngblood, Arlene Banks, Yvonne Banks, Audrey Walton, Audrey Page, and Dianne Moore wearing signs inscribed "Mother's March on Polio Tuesday January 31 7:00 - 8:00 pm," posed on stairs in front of brick building, street no. 809, possibly in Schenley Heights
